13.44.text:
JASON SILVA: I think that one
of the things that we enjoy

15.81.text:
the most as human beings
is to lose ourselves

20.04.text:
in an experience,
to find ourselves

22.50.text:
in a situation in which
the gravity of the moment,

27.02.text:
the weight of the now, is so
powerful that we find ourselves

33.30.text:
You become what you
behold, so to speak,

36.54.text:
so that our neurotic,
inner critic--

39.43.text:
the voice in our head
that is nagging us,

42.37.text:
anxious about the future
or saddened by the past,

47.20.text:
paralyzed by the past--
instead goes silent,

50.49.text:
and there is grace
in this moment.

52.81.text:
The weight of the now in all
of its gravity and splendor--

57.01.text:
particularly in a
preconfigured, epic context--

61.09.text:
can serve to purge
you of your angst.

67.15.text:
I think when I come to a
place like this, whenever

69.72.text:
I put myself outside myself,
I am able to pierce the veil.

73.94.text:
I am able to see beyond my
concerns and my constraints,

77.50.text:
and I connect with something
larger than myself.

79.50.text:
It's something that
we can all relate to.

81.66.text:
It's something that
we seek out, right?

84.20.text:
And these moments, these
moments do something to us

96.36.text:
We address the existential
panic, the ontological panic,

100.56.text: and we push it out of our minds.

103.20.text:
Death goes from being
an imminent panic

108.42.text:
Thoughts of mortality
dissipate, and we

110.65.text:
get to inhabit some kind of
eternal now-- immortality

113.82.text:
now as we smash our sense
of separateness in temples

116.99.text:
of fragmentation in what
Alan Harrington called

121.43.text:
It doesn't matter if it's
the rave concert or Burning

124.37.text:
Man or an opera theater or
an IMAX screen or an epic

128.30.text:
ocean-- the point
being these vistas,

131.00.text:
these contexts, these stages
become rites of passage,

139.33.text:
We slay the dragon,
we move forth,

145.01.text:
and then the angst is
gone, at least temporarily.
